hints.Angle: The figure formed by two rays sharing a common endpoint, called the vertex.
hints.Radian: A unit of angular measurement equal to the angle subtended at the center of a circle by an arc equal in length to the radius.
hints.Degree: A unit of angular measurement equal to 1/360 of a circle.
hints.Right Triangle: A triangle with one angle measuring 90 degrees.
hints.Hypotenuse: The longest side of a right triangle, opposite the right angle.
hints.Sine (sin): In a right triangle, the ratio of the length of the side opposite an angle to the length of the hypotenuse.
hints.Cosine (cos): In a right triangle, the ratio of the length of the adjacent side to an angle to the length of the hypotenuse.
hints.Tangent (tan): In a right triangle, the ratio of the length of the side opposite an angle to the length of the adjacent side.
hints.Pythagorean Theorem: A theorem that states that the square of the length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle is equal to the sum of the squares of the lengths of the other two sides.
hints.Cotangent (cot): The reciprocal of the tangent function; the ratio of the length of the adjacent side to an angle to the length of the opposite side.
hints.Secant (sec): The reciprocal of the cosine function; the ratio of the length of the hypotenuse to the length of the adjacent side.
hints.Cosecant (csc): The reciprocal of the sine function; the ratio of the length of the hypotenuse to the length of the opposite side.
hints.Trigonometric Identities: Equations involving trigonometric functions that are true for all angles in their domain.
hints.Unit Circle: A circle with a radius of 1, centered at the origin of a coordinate plane.
hints.Inverse Trigonometric Functions: Functions that find the angle measure given the value of a trigonometric function (sin^-1, cos^-1, tan^-1, etc.).
